channel.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
channel.description:
I did some small exercices vor OOProgramming (Java), if anyone has too much time on his/her hands and could give me some feedback about what I wrote? Eventually any tips what I should do better etc? Any help is greatly appreciated!
Note: I've only had one Java lesson at this moment
Exercices: Title - Link
Product: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:368a Age: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:368b Operations: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:368c BMI: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:368d Sum: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:368e Exchange: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:368f Sequences: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:3690 Extremes: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:3691 Triangle: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:3692
Median: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:3693 Tables: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:3694 Growth: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:3695 Dice: http://codeviewer.org/view/code:3696

item.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.description:
@VbCoder wrote:

Pwnd:

Add graphics? lul

Graphics are for later :d

Pwnd:

Oh, and if they enter multiple characters, have it iterate through the entered text as a char array. This way you don’t have to check to see if they entered one character and it’ll make it slightly easier to play, I guess.

Thanks! I’ve redone it that way:
http://codeviewer.org/view/code:36a2

Bowser jr:

Retrieve the words from a file, and add some more normal non-Dutch words.

Ok, that’s up next!
And yeah sorry about that, I also released the source code to my fellow students so I used Dutch words for that

Read full topic

item.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Retrieve the words from a file, and add some more normal non-Dutch words.

Read full topic

item.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Add graphics? lul

Oh, and if they enter multiple characters, have it iterate through the entered text as a char array. This way you don’t have to check to see if they entered one character and it’ll make it slightly easier to play, I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.description:
@VbCoder wrote:

They aren’t just out of a book :c

And yeah, but I couldn’t really work with lists at that moment…

I now made a simple hangman game… could anyone give me some feedback on it how I could improve it?
http://codeviewer.org/view/code:369e

Read full topic

item.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Did seem like you did them out of a book lol.

For the median program to allow “infinite” amounts of input, I’d probably just sort an array and take the middle values.

Read full topic

item.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
item.dc:creator: @VbCoder VbCoder
item.description:
@VbCoder wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:2, topic:531136”]All I did was look at the age and median calculations.

The age should have an input of what the current year is as well. The median should have as many inputs as you want. Just a tip to make it a slight better.

Any way, great job. You did better than I did when I tried at first attempt.[/quote]

Thank you (:

But actually it are exercises which I had to do that way

Read full topic

item.title: Java apps, looking for feedback
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

All I did was look at the age and median calculations.

The age should have an input of what the current year is as well. The median should have as many inputs as you want. Just a tip to make it a slight better.

Any way, great job. You did better than I did when I tried at first attempt.

Read full topic
